1181989077953982464.text:
Question to panel: What advice do you have for incoming freshmen on getting involved?

Grace: Join one club first and use that as a stepping stone and it will lead to other opportunities, I guarantee it!

#2019SLS

1181988402675294209.text:
Question to panel: How did you pick a college?

Megan: Visit campus! Ask about internships or study abroad opportunities and about job placement percentages. Make yourself a pros and cons sheet. You want to make sure to make the right decision for the next four years. 

#2019SLS

1181987725202857989.text:
Question to panel: What’s your advice on joining clubs/organization or running for an office as a freshman? 

Elizabeth: If you want to run for an office or position do it! Get out there and challenge yourself.

#2019SLS

651106850499395584.text: We had over 220 students from across Southwest Indiana and the Wabash Valley participate in our Student Leadership Summit today. #2015SLS

651104086503358464.text: Glad they were able to attend! https://t.co/junKzeLYYW

651099463512100865.text: Gave closing remarks for our Student Leadership Summit. My message: Think big and big things will happen! #2015SLS http://t.co/Qd3RT2a3jN

651084880462356481.text: Megan: "Find groups with your passions. Fine organizations with values that align with yours." #2015SLS

651084619459227648.text: Student question to panel: "What are good ways to meet people in college?" #2015SLS

651084439536144384.text: Jalen: "I immediately got involved to establish roots in my home away from home." #2015SLS

651084288205692928.text: Megan: "Mom was sad. We created a plan to talk on the phone or text on a regular basis. Establish that communication plan." #2015SLS

651084137462370305.text: Joslyn: "I got very involved in college groups to keep my mind off missing my family. I'm always staying busy." #2015SLS

651083855705845760.text: My question to the panel: Talk about your first month of college. Emotionally being away from family or overwhelmed. #2015SLS

651083163796656128.text: Jalen: "It's not always about learning. It's about learning to learn." #2015SLS

651083048805601281.text: Jalen: "I found it helpful to set goals. Both long term and short term." #2015SLS

651082894883074049.text: Question to panel: "What are some exercises or anything to help with the workload I'll have in college?" #2015SLS

651081479695503360.text: Question to panel: "How did you prioritize things in college?" Megan: "Follow your passions and dreams & join clubs you enjoy. #2015SLS

651080429014024197.text: Advice to students from Jalen: "My biggest piece of advice is to accept responsibility." #2015SLS

651080145680379904.text: Advice to students from Megan: "Use the personal connections you make to help you in college. Building relationships is important." #2015SLS

651079957498695680.text: Advice to students from Joslyn: "Take criticism and use it to better yourself." #2015SLS

651079774488686592.text: Advice to students from Hunter: "Humility is the #1 leadership skill I recommend. It has gotten me pretty far in life so far." #2015SLS

651077765798739968.text: Starting our student panel Q/A session with current @VincennesU and @UEvansville students. #2015SLS http://t.co/0XBpKcLa4O

651074130981355520.text: Students in their small group lessons facilitated by the @UEvansville Leadership Academy. #2015SLS http://t.co/vgX1s0xxd6

651073737954066432.text: One of the students flying his airplane during the activity. Team w/ the most planes across the line wins. #2015SLS http://t.co/aFIP2SQqmP

651072816197050368.text: Next activity: the airplane game. The goal is to challenge processes and learn to think outside of the box. #2015SLS http://t.co/n8Sls7N1NU

651070241867493376.text: A student from North Knox won the #2015SLS rock-paper-scissors tournament! http://t.co/eZRLqIRUkU

651068848473509888.text: The @UEvansville Leadership Academy begins by leading the entire summit in a rock-paper-scissors tournament. #2015SLS http://t.co/Hjr6etGybP

651063931839102976.text: (2/2) "...Use that to improve your understanding of situations to better explain them to others." @purduemitch  #2015SLS

651063795532570624.text: (1/2) "No matter how prepared you are, there will always be criticism..." #2015SLS

651062581998841856.text: "Yes. It's always important to listen to criticism because an argument might arise that you never thought of." @purduemitch #2015SLS

651062420543307776.text: Student question to @purduemitch: "Did criticism ever sway a decision?" #2015SLS

651061901233889280.text: "We have to be a state who is lead by people who won't settle." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651055452038524928.text: .@purduemitch: "Keep moving forward. Don't settle for middle of the road. Look for new things that will make us a stronger, better state."

651055093110964224.text: Student question to @purduemitch: "200 years of statehood. What can we do for the next 200 years to move forward?" #2015SLS

651054877687197696.text: .@purduemitch on Churchill: "Remarkable combination. He never quit studying, had immense courage, and never stopped learning." #2015SLS

651054503823810560.text: Student question to @purduemitch: "Who have you worked with or studied that is the best leader?" Answer: "Winston Churchill." #2015SLS

651053329276104706.text: (2/2) "...They will contact you. You don't have to go brag on it. Your most valuable contacts will find you." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651053131762151424.text: (1/2) "I didn't seek out mentors as much as I should have. The best way to make contacts is to do a good job..." #2015SLS

651052822587441152.text: Student question to @purduemitch: "How did you make connections?" #2015SLS

651052150127239168.text: (2/2) "...you will learn so much from that, that it might position you for future success." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651051986780057600.text: (1/2) "I like trying different things. If you're willing, when an opportunity knocks..." #2015SLS

651051757989154816.text: "Greater gratification comes in the form of results." - @purduemitch  #2015SLS

651051483564244993.text: Student question to @purduemitch: "What's your biggest motivation?" #2015SLS

651051082844622848.text: (2/2) "I try to concentrate on things that didn't go well. You're human. There's a lesson to be learned." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651050929567977472.text: (1/2) "I try not to dwell on the things that went well. I'm happy and fulfilled..." #2015SLS

651050643336118272.text: Question: "You've accomplished a lot. What is your biggest success?" #2015SLS

651048645899513857.text: .@purduemitch now taking questions from students. #2015SLS http://t.co/CqrYgD9UOB

651048180302409728.text: "I didn't find 'oops' to be a hard word to say. I failed & made mistakes. You have to be prepared for the things that don't go your way."

651047920834322432.text: "The right decision won't always be 100% clear. You have to learn to take chances." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651047799384113152.text: "Don't ask people to work harder than you. Don't ask them to do things you yourself wouldn't do." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651047668186267648.text: .@purduemitch on integrity and character: "People will not follow someone they don't trust. Tell. The. Truth." #2015SLS

651047427282223104.text: "Read bios of great leaders and one day you might face the same challenge. You can take from that knowledge." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651047171488411648.text: .@purduemitch says learn from other leaders. "Share their formulas for success and learn from their mistakes and failures." #2015SLS

651046579428831233.text: On History: "There's almost no problem you'll face as a leader that hasn't already happened." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651046013227134977.text:
"English, math, science,
history. If you want to be a leader there is no way to do so w/o a basic knowledge of those fields." #2015SLS

651045646842109952.text: "Congrats on being here. You're already considered leaders." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

651045355749003266.text: .@purduemitch takes the stage to talk about leadership and his experiences. #2015SLS http://t.co/QqCHV2bopU

651041644104556544.text: Shepard Dunn tells of Peyton Manning's experience as a freshman rookie starting at UT. "When in command, take charge." #2015SLS

651040512217116672.text: "You have to invest in yourself and others. Investing in yourself creates opportunities to become a better person." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS

651039196090658816.text: (2/2) "Admit your faults and mistakes. You have to learn how to say I was wrong." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS

651039102243053568.text: (1/2) "2 things on leadership: get out of your comfort zone. You don't learn when you're in your comfort zone..." #2015SLS

651038707991101441.text: "You're never too old to learn. Don't stop learning. When you do, you stop growing." - Shepard Dunn #2015SLS

651038251235549184.text: "Raise your hand at school, at church, in community. Say pick me, I'll do a good job." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS

651037971370639360.text: (2/2) 2nd: a little luck involved. Few people change careers and find themselves as President and CEO of a company." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS

651037768160800768.text: (1/2) "2 things that made me successful: I've taken advantage of situations presented to me..." #2015SLS

651037445765640192.text: President & CEO of Bestway Express, Shepard Dunn takes the stage. #2015SLS http://t.co/4eu4oYFxTl

651035305793953793.text: "Success. It takes organization. Time management is important. You have to balance your time w/ school, work, dating." Prof Keegan #2015SLS

651034953363361792.text: (2/2) "In high school. You've been chosen to attend this leadership summit which is a great start." - Professor Keegan #2015SLS

651034798312566784.text: (1/2) "Your goals? Your dreams? How do you achieve them? It starts now. Today..." #2015SLS
